abstract: The chef, Rick Bayless, will serve a Mexican-influenced dinner with wine pairings as he tries to cook his way into the heart of an unhappy woman in "Cascabel."
lead_paragraph: The celebrity chef Rick Bayless will take to the Chicago stage this March. Collaborating with the Lookingglass Theater Company, Mr. Bayless will serve the audience a Mexican-influenced dinner with wine pairings as he tries to cook his way into the heart of an unhappy woman in "Cascabel." Mr. Bayless created the show with Tony Hernandez and Heidi Stillman, who are directing it together. Promoted as "a theatrical feast," the show will run from March 21 through April 22 at the Water Tower Pumping Station. Tickets - for $200 to $225 - include dinner.

headline.main: A Celebrity Chef Will Take to the Chicago Stage
